xmbean.description:
XDS Config Service
Provides a Service to save and load XDS Configurations.
It use the XMLAttributePersistenceManager to store the attributes in xml files. To separate the files from normal JMX Persistance we use the Version feature. Therefore all files for a saved configuration are placed in a directory: <VersionPrefix><configName>

attribute.description:
List of services and their attributes to store as configuration.

Format: <MBean>:<attributeList>
MBean: Either the full ObjectName or the service name when serviceDomainPrefix can be applied.
attributeList: attribute names separated by ',', or '*' for all attributes of the MBean.
attribute.name: AttributesToStore

attribute.description:
Version prefix to build version for Persistance manager.
The version used to store a configuration:<VersionPrefix><configName>
attribute.name: VersionPrefix

attribute.description:
Default ServiceDomainPrefix for the AttributesToStore List.
With this prefix you can use the service name (e.g. XDSService) in the AttributesToStore list instead of the full qualified ObjectName String (e.g. dcm4chee.archive:service=XDSService)
attribute.name: ServiceDomainPrefix

operation.description: Save an XDS configuration for given name.
operation.name: save

operation.description: Load a XDS configuration for given name.
operation.name: load
